pullRequest.body:
Defines `FirstOrder.Language.Theory.Formula`: `T.Formula Î±` is the quotient of `L.Formula Î±` by
  equivalence modulo a theory `T`.
Puts a boolean algebra instance on `T.Formula Î±`, with `â‰¤` corresponding to implication.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [fd38e53272](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/16801/commits/fd38e532721ed7e5dc9b2dc5d047fa792f6de8b0)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Formula`
`+ Realize`
`+ all`
`+ ex`
`+ iff_comm`
`+ iff_iff_models_iff`
`+ imp_congr`
`+ imp_mono`
`+ inf_congr`
`+ inf_mono`
`+ instance : BooleanAlgebra (T.Formula Î±)`
`+ instance : Coe (L.Formula Î±) (T.Formula Î±) := âŸ¨toAntisymmetrization _âŸ©`
`+ instance : IsPreorder (L.BoundedFormula Î± n) T.Imp`
`+ instance : PartialOrder (T.Formula Î±) := by`
`+ models_sentence_imp`
`+ not`
`+ preorder`
`+ realize_bd_imp`
`+ realize_coe`
`+ realize_imp`
`+ sup_congr`
`+ sup_mono`
`- imp`
`- mp`
`- mpr`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
I think it would be better to define `T.BoundedFormula Î± n` and then set `abbrev T.Formula Î± := T.BoundedFormula Î± 0` mirroring the situation of `L.BoundedFormula Î± n` and `L.Formula Î±`.

My hope for this is to only create 1 more API, rather than 3 (`BoundedFormula, Formula, Sentence`), because juggling between the three of those is possibly the most annoying part of this model theory library.

The reason for `BoundedFormula` existing at all is to be able to define quantifiers inductively - these are what you should use if you're dealing syntactically with a particular way of writing a formula, but here I'm hoping to abstract that stuff out. If you want to use quantifiers on the boolean algebra, you still can, through [Formula.iAlls](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/ModelTheory/Syntax.html#FirstOrder.Language.Formula.iAlls) and such.

If we do go for defining the quotient type for bounded formulas, then the first thing we will want is to construct the isomorphism `T.BoundedFormula Î± n â‰ƒo T.Formula (Î± âŠ• Fin n)`, showing that the boolean algebras are equivalent.

Still, I'm willing to be convinced otherwise. @metinersin , do you have a use case in mind where you think `T.BoundedFormula Î± n` would be better?

I accept that dealing with three different types can be confusing. However, `L.Sentence` is just an abbreviation for `L.Formula Empty` and `L.Formula Î±` is just an abbreviation for `L.BoundedFormula Î± 0`. The level of difficulty of proving/defining things using formulas and bounded formulas are identically equal but the former has some technical debt.

I think the most important use case of this API is being able pass back and forth between formulas/bounded formulas and the quotient type. Any operation on the level of formulas respecting semantic equivalence should also be available on the quotient type, and the routine and easier way to build formulas containing quantifiers is building them from bounded formulas.

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#16799~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#16800~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ðŸ¤–). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->
Sorry, this PR completely fell off my radar. Feel free to rerequest my review if I don't reply within a week or so.
Sorry, this PR completely fell off my radar. Feel free to rerequest my review if I don't reply within a week or so.

```suggestion
theorem sup_congr {Ï† Ïˆ Ï†' Ïˆ' : L.BoundedFormula Î± n}
    (h : Ï† â‡”[T] Ïˆ) (h' : Ï†' â‡”[T] Ïˆ') :
    Ï† âŠ” Ï†' â‡”[T] Ïˆ âŠ” Ïˆ' := by
```
Same

This is a special case of antisymmetrisation (see the similarly named type). Could you try reusing it to see whether it's practical to use? And if it isn't, whether there's anything we can do about it
I had assumed that antisymmetrization would only be implemented for a `Preorder` instance. Now I see that it isn't, and this looks very promising - I'll give it a shot.
One issue you might run into is the mismatch between `Iff` and `Imp and Imp`, but now that I'm thinking about it it seems that they actually match in your case?

It looks not too bad to redefine `T.Iff` as `AntisymmRel T.Imp` - I think this might be better, so that equality in the quotient is definitionally `T.Iff`, but there will be a decent amount of `diff` in this PR if I do that.
Is `T.Iff = AntisymmRel T.Imp` not defeq already?
No - the proof is a few applications of `forall_and`.
I've now given it a shot.

```suggestion
@[simp, norm_cast]
lemma realize_coe (Ï† : L.Formula Î±) {M : Type*} [L.Structure M] [M âŠ¨ T] [Nonempty M] (v : Î± â†’ M) :
```
maybe?

`norm_cast` gives an error (when I use `Antisymmetrization` and when I don't) along the lines of
```
norm_cast: badly shaped lemma, lhs must contain at least one coe
  Realize (toAntisymmetrization T.Imp Ï†) v
 ```
Also, the linter doesn't like this as a `simp` lemma - much of it already simplifies. I'll try to see if there's a good remaining simp lemma to add instead.

```suggestion
  Theory.iff_iff_models_iff.2 fun M v xs => by rw [realize_iff, realize_toPrenex]
```
Doesn't hurt compacting here

```suggestion
-- See note [reducible non instances]
abbrev preorder (T : L.Theory) : Preorder (L.BoundedFormula Î± n) where
```

```suggestion
theorem realize_bd_mono {Ï† Ïˆ : L.BoundedFormula Î± n} (h : Ï† âŸ¹[T] Ïˆ)
```
maybe?
Does `gcongr` eat these kinds of lemmas?
I'd not seen `gcongr` before - I've tried using it to no avail, but it might just be because I'm unfamiliar with it.
Possible scope-creep, but you are missing `_comm`

```suggestion
  Theory.iff_iff_models_iff.2 fun M v xs => by simp
```
and below

pullRequest.title: feat(ModelTheory/Equivalence): The quotient type of formulas modulo a theory
